definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Idealized research methods to solve the historiography of measurement was first crisis.
sentences.chinese: 理想化的研究方法首先解決了計量史學的危機。

sentences.english: This does not mean, however, that an idealized layered architecture must be implemented with no compromises.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這並不意味着必須實現理想化的分層架構。

sentences.english: One is reminded of the idealized image of feudal Europe presented by latter-day conservative Catholics such as G.
sentences.chinese: 這喚起了我們對中世紀歐洲的理想化印象，它在G。

sentences.english: Learn to like and ideally to love yourself.
sentences.chinese: 學會喜歡並且理想化的愛自己。

sentences.english: Certainly, the soccer is not only the idealization , is the reality.
sentences.chinese: 當然，足球不僅僅是理想化的，更是現實的。

sentences.english: It's a long way from the idealised decision-maker.
sentences.chinese: 這同理想化的決策者相去甚遠。

sentences.english: Ideally, how would you like everything to be run?
sentences.chinese: 理想化地說，你希望一切如何運轉？

sentences.english: The pure office of poetry is ever to idealize.
sentences.chinese: 詩的純正功能向來都是理想化地描繪事物。

sentences.english: So who is to blame for idealising the democratising nature of the internet?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，理想化互聯網的本質究竟應該怪誰？

sentences.english: Romantic love and motherhood are sentimentally idealized.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫的愛情和母性被多情地理想化了。

sentences.english: The 430 years number is also something of an ideal number.
sentences.chinese: 而430年也是一個理想化的數字。

sentences.english: We idealize them and can't get them off our minds.
sentences.chinese: 我們將對方理想化而且難以從腦海將之驅逐。

sentences.english: This obviously is the limiting case of the idealized monochromatic wave .
sentences.chinese: 這必然是理想化的單色波的極限波形。

sentences.english: This child had not only grown, she had become idealized.
sentences.chinese: 這一個不但長大了，而且理想化了。

sentences.english: This was the idealistic choice of life for the outstanding intellectuals in feudal age.
sentences.chinese: 這是封建時代傑出知識分子一種理想化的人生選擇。

sentences.english: You could never handle the Fish's emotional whims for any length of time.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你很難接受魚兒過於理想化的感情觀念。

definition: practical/corresponding to reality/geared to practical situations
